lorenz package¶

Submodules¶

lorenz.filehandling module¶

This file can contain functionalities for saving/loading data

Functions

write_x_y_z_tofile(var, filename) Write the arrays of x, y, z to a file
read_x_y_z_fromfile(filename) read x y z from file: filename
lorenz.filehandling.write_x_y_z_tofile(var, filename)[source]¶

Write the arrays of x, y, z to a file

Parameters:
  • var – x, y, z
  • filename – the target filename
Returns:

None
Return type:

None
lorenz.filehandling.read_x_y_z_fromfile(filename)[source]¶

read x y z from file: filename

Parameters:filename – The file which we want to read from
Returns:three arrays: x, y, z
Return type:numpy.arrays

lorenz.plot module¶

This file may contain functionalities for plotting

Functions

plot3Dpdf([x, y, z, sigma, beta, rho]) Plot the 3D scatter of lorenz
plot2Dpdf([x, y, z, sigma, beta, rho]) Plot 3*1 subplots of 2D plot for lorenz
lorenz.plot.plot3Dpdf(x=None, y=None, z=None, sigma=10, beta=2.67, rho=6)[source]¶

Plot the 3D scatter of lorenz

Parameters:
  • x – x-axis data
  • y – y-axis data
  • z – z-axis data
  • sigma – param sigma for lorenz
  • beta – param beta for lorenz
  • rho – param rho for lorenz
Returns:

bool

  • y – y-axis data
  • z – z-axis data
  • sigma – param sigma for lorenz
  • beta – param beta for lorenz
  • rho – param rho for lorenz
Returns:

bool

lorenz.run module¶

This file may contain a convenient interface/function for

1: computing a trajectory using an ODE solver from solver.py 2: save data to file 3: plot data

and possible another function that

2: load data from file 3: plot data

Functions

run_save_plot(sigma, beta, rho, initial_arrays) Run Euler_solve, save and plot trajectory
run_load_plot(target_file, sigma, beta, rho) Read and plot trajectory
lorenz.run.run_save_plot(sigma, beta, rho, initial_arrays)[source]¶

Run Euler_solve, save and plot trajectory

Parameters:
  • sigma – sigma
  • beta – beta
  • rho – rho
  • initial_arrays – [x[0], y[0], z[0]]
Returns:

the name of saved file.
Return type:

String
lorenz.run.run_load_plot(target_file, sigma, beta, rho)[source]¶

Read and plot trajectory

Parameters:
  • target_file – The pickle file contain the traj of x, y, z
  • sigma – the sigma used for this trajectory
  • beta – the beta used for this trajectory
  • rho – the rho used for this trajectory
Returns:

None
Return type:

None

lorenz.solver module¶

This file may contain the ODE solver

Classes

ODE_solvers(sigma, beta, rho) An integrated ODE solvers
class lorenz.solver.ODE_solvers(sigma, beta, rho)[source]¶

Bases: object

An integrated ODE solvers By giving the initial parameters, we can construct the ODE solver

Example:
solver = ODE_solver(sigma, beta, rho)
Euler_solve(initial_arrays, N=50000, t_sigma=0.01)[source]¶

Solve the equation with Euler approach

Parameters:
  • initial_arrays – list of initial values for x[0], y[0], z[0]
  • N – the total steps to calculate the equation
  • t_sigma – the minimal step
Returns:

arrays of [x, y, z], size(3*n)
Return type:

numpy.arrays

lorenz.util module¶

This file may contain utility functionalities to the extend you will need it

Functions

mkdir_p(mypath) Creates a directory.
lorenz.util.mkdir_p(mypath)[source]¶

Creates a directory. equivalent to using mkdir -p on the command line
